cards.name: Paliano Vanguard
cards.text:

Other creatures you control of a type you noted for cards named Paliano Vanguard get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: "I gladly offer my weapon and my life to the glory of my sovereign."
cards.name: Protector of the Crown
cards.text:
When Protector of the Crown enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to Protector of the Crown instead.

cards.flavor: Before a cause can have supporters, it has to have a voice.
cards.name: Recruiter of the Guard
cards.text: When Recruiter of the Guard enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card with toughness 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "These halls are sacred. You will be silent."
cards.name: Sanctum Prelate
cards.text:
As Sanctum Prelate enters the battlefield, choose a number.
Noncreature spells with converted mana cost equal to the chosen number can't be cast.

cards.name: Spectral Grasp
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.
Enchanted creature can't block creatures you control.

cards.flavor: "Rulers come and go, but my allegiance belongs to the throne."
cards.name: Throne Warden
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if you're the monarch, put a +1/+1 counter on Throne Warden.

cards.flavor: Within the city walls, Adriana's falcons hunt vermin of all kinds.
cards.name: Wings of the Guard
cards.text:
Flying
Melee (Whenever this creature attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each opponent you attacked with a creature this combat.)

cards.text:
Before you shuffle your deck to start the game, you may reveal this card from your deck and exile an instant or sorcery card you drafted that isn't in your deck.
When Arcane Savant enters the battlefield, copy a card you exiled with cards named Arcane Savant. You may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: The most effective roadways in Paliano aren't roads at all.

cards.text:
When Canal Courier enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
Whenever Canal Courier and another creature attack different players, Canal Courier can't be blocked this combat.

cards.name: Coveted Peacock
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Coveted Peacock attacks, you may goad target creature defending player controls. (Until your next turn, that creature attacks each combat if able and attacks a player other than you if able.)

cards.flavor: Few things are more valuable than time or money—and Leovold has plenty of both.

cards.text: Council's dilemma — Starting with you, each player votes for time or money. For each time vote, take an extra turn after this one. For each money vote, choose a permanent owned by the voter and gain control of it. Exile Expropriate.

cards.flavor:
"Please vote with a clear head and vigilant heart, knowing each voice is meaningful regardless of the outcome."
—Ottavio d'Oro,
Electoral Committee Speaker of Paliano

You choose how each player votes this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.text:

Flying

cards.text:
{6}{U}: Monstrosity 4. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put four +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

Flash

cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Weldfast Wingsmith gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Drakes prowl the skies of Kaladesh, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.
cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "I don't know what that is or who it belongs to, but it's shiny and I want it."
cards.name: Aetherborn Marauder
cards.text:
Flying, lifelink
When Aetherborn Marauder enters the battlefield, move any number of +1/+1 counters from other permanents you control onto Aetherborn Marauder.

cards.flavor: Aetherborn who are unwilling to accept the decomposition of their bodies invent ways to preserve and augment themselves.
cards.name: Ambitious Aetherborn
cards.text: Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

cards.name: Demon of Dark Schemes
cards.text:
Flying
When Demon of Dark Schemes enters the battlefield, all other creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Whenever another creature dies, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{2}{B}, Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control tapped.

cards.flavor: Baral's spies always have the latest technology.
cards.name: Dhund Operative
cards.text: As long as you control an artifact, Dhund Operative gets +1/+0 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor:
"Show them. Show them how hot your fire can burn."
—Liliana Vess, to Chandra Nalaar
cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "When the time comes, let go. Nothing lasts forever."
cards.name: Die Young
cards.text: Choose target creature. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters), then you may pay any amount of {E}. The creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each {E} paid this way.

cards.flavor: The teeth marks add character.
cards.name: Dukhara Scavenger
cards.text: When Dukhara Scavenger enters the battlefield, you may put target artifact or creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.flavor: Open hostilities are strictly forbidden at the Inventors' Fair, but "accidents" still happen.
cards.name: Eliminate the Competition
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Eliminate the Competition, sacrifice X creatures.
Destroy X target creatures.

cards.flavor: In Embraal, inventor gangs defend their turf with ingenious devices and blunt objects.
cards.name: Embraal Bruiser
cards.text:
Embraal Bruiser enters the battlefield tapped.
Embraal Bruiser has menace as long as you control an artifact.

cards.flavor: The "gifted" among the aetherborn can draw the life essence of other living beings into themselves.
cards.name: Essence Extraction
cards.text: Essence Extraction deals 3 damage to target creature and you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: An aetherborn wastes neither time nor treasure.
cards.name: Fortuitous Find
cards.text:
Choose one or both —
• Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"My creations still can't match the dive speed of those floppy-winged mammals. Maybe I should enter one of them in the Fair."
—Viprikti, thopterist
cards.name: Foundry Screecher
cards.text:
Flying
Foundry Screecher gets +1/+0 as long as you control an artifact.

cards.flavor: The swarm leaves behind a flawless pattern that only occasionally threatens the structural integrity of the wood.
cards.name: Fretwork Colony
cards.text:
Fretwork Colony can't block.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Fretwork Colony and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Gonti, Lord of Luxury
cards.text:
Deathtouch
When Gonti, Lord of Luxury enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of target opponent's library, exile one of them face down, then put the rest on the bottom of that library in a random order. For as long as that card remains exiled, you may look at it, you may cast it, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any type to cast it.

cards.flavor:
"If you've done nothing wrong, you have nothing to fear."
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj
cards.name: Harsh Scrutiny
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card. Scry 1.

cards.flavor: Kaladesh's illicit marketplaces are known as "night markets," but if you know who to ask, you can find what you're looking for at any time of the day.
cards.name: Lawless Broker
cards.text: When Lawless Broker dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.

cards.flavor: "When you have the chance, take it. Laugh, sing, dance. Don't allow the night to end."
cards.name: Live Fast
cards.text: You draw two cards, lose 2 life, and get {E}{E} (two energy counters).

cards.flavor:
"That name shall not be spoken."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance
cards.name: Lost Legacy
cards.text: Choose a nonartifact, nonland card name. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. That player shuffles his or her library, then draws a card for each card exiled from hand this way.

cards.flavor: Yesterday's marvels are today's antiques.
cards.name: Make Obsolete
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Marionette Master
cards.text:
Fabricate 3 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put three +1/+1 counters on it or create three 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target opponent loses life equal to Marionette Master's power.

cards.flavor: "Nice invention there. Looks real fragile."
cards.name: Maulfist Squad
cards.text:
Menace
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

cards.name: Midnight Oil
cards.text:
Midnight Oil enters the battlefield with seven hour counters on it.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card and remove two hour counters from Midnight Oil.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of hour counters on Midnight Oil.
Whenever you discard a card, you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor: Many an inventor has collapsed under the pressure to create a flawless design.
cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.

cards.flavor: "Every creation carries a piece of its creators. Their knowledge, their dreams, their soul. That is the best part."
cards.name: Morbid Curiosity
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Morbid Curiosity, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Draw cards equal to the converted mana cost of the sacrificed permanent.

cards.flavor: The Consulate rarely cracks the coded announcement of a night market's location before dawn, and enforcers are taken care of if they wander too close.
cards.name: Night Market Lookout
cards.text: Whenever Night Market Lookout becomes tapped, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Noxious Gearhulk
cards.text:
Menace
When Noxious Gearhulk enters the battlefield, you may destroy another target creature. If a creature is destroyed this way, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.flavor: "Let me guess. You thought I was dead."
cards.name: Ovalchase Daredevil
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Ovalchase Daredevil from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: It's rare that the Prakhata Club closes its doors. It's also rare that Lord Gonti meets with Consul Kambal. What are the odds the two would occur on the same day?
cards.name: Prakhata Club Security

cards.flavor: Short lives lead to forbidden choices.
cards.name: Rush of Vitality
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains lifelink and indestructible until end of turn. (Damage dealt by that creature also causes its controller to gain that much life, and it can't be destroyed by damage or effects that say "destroy.")

cards.flavor: Renegades do some of their best work right under the Consulate's nose.
cards.name: Subtle Strike
cards.text:
Choose one or both —
• Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.flavor: "The price isn't negotiable, but I'm sure you'll agree it's fair."
cards.name: Syndicate Trafficker
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on Syndicate Trafficker. It gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: In Ghirapur, even the lowliest residents live in lavish surroundings.
cards.name: Thriving Rats
cards.text:
When Thriving Rats enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Rats attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: Aetherborn patrons use any means necessary to secure victory for their protégés.
cards.name: Tidy Conclusion
cards.text: Destroy target creature. You gain 1 life for each artifact you control.

cards.name: Underhanded Designs
cards.text:
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice Underhanded Designs: Destroy target creature. Activate this ability only if you control two or more artifacts.

cards.flavor:
"No, I don't believe they have the proper permits for those, but I'm not going to be the one to ask."
—Caru, Consulate warden
cards.name: Weaponcraft Enthusiast
cards.text: Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)

cards.name: Aethertorch Renegade
cards.text:
When Aethertorch Renegade enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}: Aethertorch Renegade deals 1 damage to target creature.
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}: Aethertorch Renegade deals 6 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: Driven by an insatiable hunger, gremlins never cease feeding. They can destroy a lifetime of work in just a few moments.
cards.name: Brazen Scourge
cards.text: Haste

cards.flavor: Free from Consulate regulations, renegade-built automatons push performance to the limit.
cards.name: Built to Smash
cards.text: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. If it's an artifact creature, it gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The chasm of years and worlds collapsed under the power of their embrace.
cards.name: Cathartic Reunion
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Cathartic Reunion, discard two cards.
Draw three cards.

cards.name: Chandra, Torch of Defiance
cards.text:
+1: Exile the top card of your library. You may cast that card. If you don't, Chandra, Torch of Defiance deals 2 damage to each opponent.
+1: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
−3: Chandra, Torch of Defiance deals 4 damage to target creature.
−7: You get an emblem with "Whenever you cast a spell, this emblem deals 5 damage to target creature or player."

cards.flavor: "This one's for my mom, and this one's for me."
cards.name: Chandra's Pyrohelix
cards.text: Chandra's Pyrohelix deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Combustible Gearhulk
cards.text:
First strike
When Combustible Gearhulk enters the battlefield, target opponent may have you draw three cards. If the player doesn't, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard, then Combustible Gearhulk deals damage to that player equal to the total converted mana cost of those cards.

cards.flavor: Most came to Ghirapur for the Fair. Gremlins came for the feast.
cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.

cards.flavor: Tonight at the Grand Exhibition, witness Head Judge Tezzeret face off against the infamous renegade Pia Nalaar.
cards.name: Fateful Showdown
cards.text: Fateful Showdown deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of cards in your hand. Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.

cards.flavor:
"Now that's the Chandra I've been waiting to see."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Furious Reprisal
cards.text: Furious Reprisal deals 2 damage to each of two target creatures and/or players.

cards.flavor: The giant-decorating contest at the migration festival is a tradition that may have started as a dare.
cards.name: Giant Spectacle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace.

cards.name: Harnessed Lightning
cards.text: Choose target creature. You get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters), then you may pay any amount of {E}. Harnessed Lightning deals that much damage to that creature.

cards.flavor: "Whoa there. Easy. We're just going to take a little detour."
cards.name: Hijack
cards.text: Gain control of target artifact or creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "All of those Consulate safety measures undone with one simple tweak."
cards.name: Incendiary Sabotage
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Incendiary Sabotage, sacrifice an artifact.
Incendiary Sabotage deals 3 damage to each creature.

cards.flavor:
"Everyone starts off making garbage. If you finally make something halfway decent, it'll be the best day of your life."
—Nehra, inventor
cards.name: Inventor's Apprentice
cards.text: Inventor's Apprentice gets +1/+1 as long as you control an artifact.

cards.name: Lathnu Hellion
cards.text:
Haste
When Lathnu Hellion enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice Lathnu Hellion unless you pay {E}{E}.

cards.name: Madcap Experiment
cards.text: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal an artifact card. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. Madcap Experiment deals damage to you equal to the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.flavor: "Knock, knock . . . too late."
cards.name: Maulfist Doorbuster
cards.text:
When Maulfist Doorbuster enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Maulfist Doorbuster attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Pia Nalaar
cards.text:
When Pia Nalaar enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
{1}{R}: Target artifact creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{1}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: Quicksmiths are eager to jump from one project to the next, relying on flashes of inspiration rather than careful research.
cards.name: Quicksmith Genius
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Architects find inspiration in the dragon's beauty of form, while artificers are influenced by the function of its fire.
cards.name: Reckless Fireweaver
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Reckless Fireweaver deals 1 damage to each opponent.

cards.flavor: "Nothing against you. It's just that waiting for Consulate clearance was never really my thing."
cards.name: Renegade Tactics
cards.text:
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: City officials once sent twenty gleaming automatons to exterminate a nest of gremlins. They soon saw the error of their ways.
cards.name: Ruinous Gremlin
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Ruinous Gremlin: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: If an elf can dream it, a dwarf can build it, and a gremlin can eat it.
cards.name: Salivating Gremlins
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Salivating Gremlins gets +2/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Skyship Stalker
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Skyship Stalker gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Skyship Stalker gains first strike until end of turn.
{R}: Skyship Stalker gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"To invent is to rebel."
—Pia Nalaar
cards.name: Spark of Creativity
cards.text: Choose target creature. Exile the top card of your library. You may have Spark of Creativity deal damage to that creature equal to the exiled card's converted mana cost. If you don't, you may play that card until end of turn.

cards.flavor: If her vehicle even has a brake, she couldn't tell you which pedal it is.
cards.name: Speedway Fanatic
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Speedway Fanatic crews a Vehicle, that Vehicle gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "The Consulate promised that we would all have access to aether. I'm just keeping them honest."
cards.name: Spireside Infiltrator
cards.text: Whenever Spireside Infiltrator becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.

cards.flavor: Graffiti of the "leaking spire" symbol is found wherever the renegades have been.
cards.name: Spontaneous Artist
cards.text:
When Spontaneous Artist enters the battlefield, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Pay {E}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Inventors from around the world have come to the Fair hoping their creations will fly, drive, or sail their way to a top prize.
cards.name: Start Your Engines
cards.text: Vehicles you control become artifact creatures until end of turn. Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Inventors have been known to capture gremlins with the intent to release them in a rival's workshop. More often than not, that plan backfires.
cards.name: Territorial Gorger
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever you get one or more {E} (energy counters), Territorial Gorger gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Consider this a high alert, people. Permission to destroy on sight. Either we take it down or it'll take down the Fair."
—Pav, gremlin watch
cards.name: Terror of the Fairgrounds

cards.flavor: Some passengers ride without tickets.
cards.name: Thriving Grubs
cards.text:
When Thriving Grubs enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Grubs attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor:
"The giants follow the flow of aether, and twice a year it leads them through here. Lesson learned. More clearance is needed."
—Sram, senior edificer
cards.name: Wayward Giant
cards.text: Menace

cards.flavor:
"The fires of invention burn in all of us. I fight for the freedom to unleash those flames."
—Pia Nalaar
cards.name: Welding Sparks
cards.text: Welding Sparks deals X damage to target creature, where X is 3 plus the number of artifacts you control.

cards.flavor:
"I'd just let the monkey have it if I were you. You can make another, but the same can't be said of your fingers."
—Turni, Greenwheel groundskeeper
cards.name: Appetite for the Unnatural
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: The power of aether draws creatures to it like a magnetic force, and those that are touched by it are forever altered.
cards.name: Arborback Stomper
cards.text:
Trample
When Arborback Stomper enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.

cards.flavor: Next to her designs, life seems like a pale imitation.
cards.name: Architect of the Untamed
cards.text:
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}: Create a 6/6 colorless Beast artifact creature token.

cards.flavor: Were she not a judge, she'd win the division herself.
cards.name: Armorcraft Judge
cards.text: When Armorcraft Judge enters the battlefield, draw a card for each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: "I've never seen a world where aether weaves through every aspect of nature."
cards.name: Attune with Aether
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters).

cards.flavor: Those who move harmoniously with the flow of aether can channel the power of the natural world.
cards.name: Blossoming Defense
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains hexproof until end of turn.

cards.name: Bristling Hydra
cards.text:
When Bristling Hydra enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Bristling Hydra. It gains hexproof until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Never before have there been so many brilliant minds and wondrous inventions in one place. Denizens from every corner of Kaladesh will flock to the once-in-a-lifetime Inventors' Fair.
cards.name: Commencement of Festivities
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to players this turn.

cards.flavor: Consulate guards who pursue fleeing renegades into the Cowl often become lost—occasionally permanently—in the city's wildest greenbelt.
cards.name: Cowl Prowler

cards.flavor: Sanctions, mandates, regulations . . . These things mean nothing to the natural world.
cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.name: Cultivator of Blades
cards.text:
Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
Whenever Cultivator of Blades attacks, you may have other attacking creatures get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is Cultivator of Blades's power.

cards.name: Dubious Challenge
cards.text: Look at the top ten cards of your library, exile up to two creature cards from among them, then shuffle your library. Target opponent may choose one of the exiled cards and put it onto the battlefield under his or her control. Put the rest onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Durable Handicraft
cards.text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
{5}{G}, Sacrifice Durable Handicraft: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.name: Elegant Edgecrafters
cards.text:
Elegant Edgecrafters can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)

cards.flavor: The louder the elephant trumpeted, the more the crowd cheered. And the more the crowd cheered . . .
cards.name: Fairgrounds Trumpeter
cards.text: At the beginning of each end step, if a +1/+1 counter was put on a permanent under your control this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Fairgrounds Trumpeter.

cards.flavor: Fairgoers were delighted to find that even outside the fairgrounds, Ghirapur was a city of wonders.
cards.name: Ghirapur Guide
cards.text: {2}{G}: Target creature you control can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less this turn.

cards.name: Highspire Artisan
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

cards.flavor: Natural evolution is often at odds with industrial progress.
cards.name: Hunt the Weak
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Then that creature fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor: Every leaf, tree, and building in Kujar has been placed to achieve maximum harmony, in accordance with the elvish philosophy known as the Great Conduit.
cards.name: Kujar Seedsculptor
cards.text: When Kujar Seedsculptor enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.

cards.flavor:
"They say Head Judge Tezzeret will be reviewing every invention at the Fair. I made sure to build something that will stand out."
—Jehvani, Vahadar artificer
cards.name: Larger Than Life
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It won't be small forever.
cards.name: Longtusk Cub
cards.text:
Whenever Longtusk Cub deals combat damage to a player, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Longtusk Cub.

cards.flavor: Many elves incorporate the beauty of nature into their inventions. Very few capture its savagery.
cards.name: Nature's Way
cards.text: Target creature you control gains vigilance and trample until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Nissa, Vital Force
cards.text:
+1: Untap target land you control. Until your next turn, it becomes a 5/5 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.
−3: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.
−6: You get an emblem with "Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card."

cards.flavor: Inspired by the thorns and brambles of the untamed wilds, elvish armor is both beautiful and formidable.
cards.name: Ornamental Courage
cards.text: Untap target creature. It gets +1/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Inspiration is reciprocal: we all have a responsibility to each other to create."
cards.name: Oviya Pashiri, Sage Lifecrafter
cards.text:
{2}{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{4}{G}, {T}: Create an X/X colorless Construct artifact creature token, where X is the number of creatures you control.

cards.flavor: Connected as artificer and invention, bonded as rider and steed.
cards.name: Peema Outrider
cards.text:
Trample
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

cards.name: Riparian Tiger
cards.text:
Trample
When Riparian Tiger enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Riparian Tiger attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Even now, Shaila's descendants proudly occupy the greenway that she refused to relinquish to the Consulate.
cards.name: Sage of Shaila's Claim
cards.text: When Sage of Shaila's Claim enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).

cards.flavor: "Creation without connection to nature is just manufacture."
cards.name: Servant of the Conduit
cards.text:
When Servant of the Conduit enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: The drake flew true. The arrow flew truer.
cards.name: Take Down
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Take Down deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
• Take Down deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.flavor: As unpredictable as aether, and just as hard to contain.
cards.name: Thriving Rhino
cards.text:
When Thriving Rhino enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Thriving Rhino attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Verdurous Gearhulk
cards.text:
Trample
When Verdurous Gearhulk enters the battlefield, distribute four +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures you control.

cards.flavor: "We all began in nature, and nature is where we belong."
cards.name: Wild Wanderer
cards.text: When Wild Wanderer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"I opened my mind to the immensity of the wonders around me. It was only then that I could see the Great Conduit."
—Rashmi, aether-seer
cards.name: Wildest Dreams
cards.text: Return X target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Wildest Dreams.

cards.flavor: Part feline, part primate, all trouble.
cards.name: Wily Bandar
cards.text: {2}{G}: Wily Bandar gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)

cards.flavor: All the aether charts in the world can't compete with the trained eye of a talented scout.
cards.name: Cloudblazer
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloudblazer enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life and draw two cards.

cards.flavor: "Don't waste my time with trifles. Bring me works of art, and I will make you rich."
cards.name: Contraband Kingpin
cards.text:
